topic.name: Historical Development of Concepts
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Historical Development of Concepts in Mathematics

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ancient Mathematics (Pythagoras, Euclid, Archimedes)
objectives.objective_text: Identify counting with fingers or stones.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Mathematics in the Islamic Golden Age
objectives.objective_text: Identify the numbers 0, 1, 2, 3.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The 19th and 20th Centuries (Set Theory, Foundations Crisis)
objectives.objective_text: Identify computers as math machines.

objectives.objective_text: Name a computer programmer (Ada Lovelace).

objectives.sub_topic_name: The 19th and 20th Centuries (Set Theory, Foundations Crisis)
objectives.objective_text: Identify logic puzzles.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ancient Mathematics (Pythagoras, Euclid, Archimedes)
objectives.objective_text: Name Pythagoras (triangles) or Archimedes (circles).

objectives.objective_text: Identify the Pyramids as a feat of math.

objectives.objective_text: Name 'Zero' as a special invention.

objectives.objective_text: Identify Al-Khwarizmi as a famous mathematician.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Mathematics in the Islamic Golden Age
objectives.objective_text: Recall that these numbers came from far away.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The 19th and 20th Centuries (Set Theory, Foundations Crisis)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that there are different sizes of 'everything'.

objectives.objective_text: Observe sorting things into groups.

objectives.objective_text: Recall that people did math long ago without computers.

objectives.objective_text: Observe Roman Numerals on a clock.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The 19th and 20th Centuries (Set Theory, Foundations Crisis)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize that math can be about logic, not just numbers.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The 19th and 20th Centuries (Set Theory, Foundations Crisis)
objectives.objective_text: Explain that infinity is not just one big number.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The 19th and 20th Centuries (Set Theory, Foundations Crisis)
objectives.objective_text: Explain why $1+1=2$ takes hundreds of pages to prove (Principia).

objectives.sub_topic_name: The 19th and 20th Centuries (Set Theory, Foundations Crisis)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the distinction between truth and provability.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ancient Mathematics (Pythagoras, Euclid, Archimedes)
objectives.objective_text: Explain how Archimedes used water to measure volume.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ancient Mathematics (Pythagoras, Euclid, Archimedes)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the difference between practical (Egyptian) and theoretical (Greek) math.

objectives.objective_text: Defend the influence of Greek thought on Western civilization.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Mathematics in the Islamic Golden Age
objectives.objective_text: Explain why Zero is important for place value.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Mathematics in the Islamic Golden Age
objectives.objective_text: Defend the collaborative nature of mathematical history.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Mathematics in the Islamic Golden Age
objectives.objective_text: Observe patterns in tiles (geometry).

objectives.objective_text: Identify art that looks like real life (Perspective).

objectives.objective_text: Name a painter who used math (Leonardo).

objectives.objective_text: Identify Fibonacci and his sequence.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ancient Mathematics (Pythagoras, Euclid, Archimedes)
objectives.objective_text: Compare Roman Numerals with our numbers (Hindu-Arabic).

objectives.objective_text: Analyze the Pythagorean brotherhood's view of numbers as divine.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Mathematics in the Islamic Golden Age
objectives.objective_text: Compare writing numbers with and without zero.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The 19th and 20th Centuries (Set Theory, Foundations Crisis)
objectives.objective_text: Compare human calculation with machine calculation.

objectives.objective_text: Analyze Hilbert's list of unsolved problems.

objectives.objective_text: Interpret the search for a perfect logical foundation.

objectives.objective_text: Connect Alan Turing to the modern computer.

objectives.objective_text: Connect the Library of Alexandria to the spread of knowledge.

objectives.objective_text: Connect geometric art (tessellations) to theology (avoiding idols).

objectives.objective_text: Summarize Euclid's role as the 'Father of Geometry'.

objectives.objective_text: Explain the synthesis of Indian arithmetic and Greek geometry.

objectives.objective_text: Recall that plus (+) and minus (-) are symbols.

objectives.objective_text: Observe distance in a painting.

objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the shattering of the formalist dream.

objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the rigor of Euclidean proofs compared to modern standards.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Mathematics in the Islamic Golden Age
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the development of the decimal positional system.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Renaissance and the Birth of Algebra
objectives.objective_text: Explain the acceptance of negative numbers.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Renaissance and the Birth of Algebra
objectives.objective_text: Summarize how art and math worked together.

objectives.objective_text: Explain the invention of symbols (equals sign).

objectives.objective_text: Defend the explosion of scientific inquiry during this period.

objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the discovery of irrational numbers with the crisis it caused.

objectives.objective_text: Construct an overview of GÃ¶del's Incompleteness Theorems.

objectives.objective_text: Synthesize Set Theory paradoxes (Russell's Paradox).

objectives.objective_text: Construct a timeline of the axiomatic method's development.

objectives.objective_text: Construct an overview of the House of Wisdom in Baghdad.

objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the solution of cubic equations.

objectives.objective_text: Identify Isaac Newton.

objectives.objective_text: Name the apple falling (Gravity).

objectives.objective_text: Identify the telescope.

objectives.objective_text: Interpret the development of trigonometry for astronomy.

objectives.objective_text: Compare word problems with symbolic equations.

objectives.objective_text: Analyze the shift from rhetorical (words) to symbolic algebra.

objectives.objective_text: Interpret the competition to solve polynomials (Tartaglia/Cardano).

objectives.objective_text: Observe a rainbow (prism).

objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the impact of the printing press on mathematical standardization.

objectives.objective_text: Connect perspective drawing to projective geometry.

objectives.objective_text: Summarize the study of change and motion.

objectives.objective_text: Explain that Newton used math to describe God's laws.

objectives.objective_text: Explain the notation differences ($dy/dx$ vs $\dot{y}$).

objectives.objective_text: Defend the mechanistic worldview vs. a providential one.

objectives.objective_text: Construct a history of the complex number ($i$).

objectives.objective_text: Synthesize algebraic notation evolution.

objectives.objective_text: Connect infinitesimals to 'ghosts of departed quantities'.
